subject: Climate & Environment
title: The Duck Curve Problem
description: A fast breakdown of The Duck Curve Problem for builders.

hook.text: California's grid operators noticed their demand chart looked like a duck. It was a warning.

buildup.text: Midday solar floods the grid with cheap power, pushing demand for other sources down.

discovery.text: At sunset, solar vanishes and demand surges â€” the grid must ramp up fast to fill the gap.

twist.text: This steep ramp strains power plants not designed to start and stop quickly.

climax.text: Batteries, demand response, and smart pricing are all needed to flatten the duck.

punchline.text: Too much solar at noon is a problem only storage can solve.

quiz.question: What causes the 'duck curve' in electricity demand?
options: Solar floods the grid at midday then vanishes at sunset
People use less power at night
